issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: WorkloadManagent Event Summary leaving subscribedCounters and currentCounters fields empty

comments.body: [~sershe] can you please take a look? Instead of resetting the counters on move, this patch appends to the existing list.

Why would it do that? It makes sense that when the query moves to a different pool with different triggers, the list of the relevant counters changes.
Or am I missing something?

subscribedCounters and currentCounters changes the intent from current pool only to all the pools along the way. I think it helps with debugging. Just by looking at the event trace json, it is counter intuitive (there are no subscribed counters but there is trigger violation). So this patch changes the trace to remember all subscribed triggers from all pools used by the query.
